intro: Codia mackeeana, commonly known as the Mackee's codia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
